sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the Lévy C curve after 5 iterations, if the original line segment has a length of 2 units?
message_2:
The Lévy C curve is a self-replicating fractal. After each iteration, the length of the curve increases by a factor of √2. So, after 5 iterations, the total length of the Lévy C curve can be calculated as follows:

Original length × (√2)^number of iterations
= 2 × (√2)^5
= 2 × (2^(5/2))
= 2 × 2^(2.5)
= 2 × (2^2) × (2^0.5)
= 2 × 4 × √2
= 8 × √2 ≈ 11.3137 units

So, the total length of the Lévy C curve after 5 iterations is approximately 11.3137 units.
